intro: Bulbine monophylla, commonly known as the white bulbine, is a striking succulent native to South Africa. It features rosettes of fleshy, light green to white leaves that store water, adapting it to arid environments. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers during the warmer months, adding a vibrant touch to its appearance. It thrives in full sun and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its resilience and aesthetic appeal make it a valued plant in both horticultural and ecological contexts.
